channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Explosions heard in Venezuela’s Caracas. Is the US behind the blasts? What does Maduro say?
Who is Christian Sturdivant? 18-yr-old arrested for plotting an IS-inspired NYE attack in North Carolina
From subway ride to antisemitism accusation: How Zohran Mamdani’s first day as NYC mayor unfolded
This Week in Explainers: How water contamination crisis unfolded in India’s ‘cleanest city’
Inside China's ‘fat prisons’, where the obese are locked up
Siddhartha Bhaiya passes away at 47. Who was veteran fund manager?
Why New Delhi must master narrative warfare against US-China manoeuvres
item.description: External powers like the US and China are constantly trying to script India's relationships to fit their own visions of the world order, and this is the latest test of whether India can assert its own agency

item.title: India’s Bangladesh policy must prioritise strategic restraint, diversified diplomacy
item.description: The coming months are critical for India to recalibrate its Bangladesh policy, emphasising engagement with moderate political actors and addressing security concerns to avert a deeper strategic setback

item.title: India and Bangladesh: Whose ‘chicken neck’, whose vulnerabilities?
item.description: As India plays mature diplomacy, subtle signals are being sent

item.title: Parallel ambitions in the Gulf: Why Saudi-UAE equations demand a re-reading
item.description: In international politics, the most dangerous misjudgment is mistaking competition among partners for conflict among adversaries

item.title: Sheikh Hasina’s trial: My argument was misread
item.description: At no point did I suggest that procedural criticism invalidates the moral or legal responsibility established by the tribunal’s findings

item.title: Why US is so obsessed with Greenland
item.description: Resource rich Greenland is geographically part of North America, just off Canada’s coast, with its nearest European neighbour, Iceland, about 200 miles across the Denmark Strait—making it indispensable for the US
